edu.harvard.util.graph.layout

Interface GraphLayoutAlgorithm

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbegoTreeLayout, Graphviz

    public interface GraphLayoutAlgorithm
    A graph layout algorithm
    Author:
    Peter Macko

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GraphLayout computeLayout(BaseGraph graph, JobObserver observer)
      Compute the layout for the entire graph
      java.lang.String getName()
      Get the name of the algorithm
      GraphLayout initializeLayout(BaseGraph graph, int levels, JobObserver observer)
      Initialize the graph layout for the given graph
      boolean isZoomOptimized()
      Determine whether the algorithm produces zoom-based (or zoom-optimized) layouts

      Update an existing layout by incrementally expanding the given summary node

    • Method Detail

      • initializeLayout

        GraphLayout initializeLayout(BaseGraph graph,
                             int levels,
                             JobObserver observer)
        Initialize the graph layout for the given graph
        Parameters:
        graph - the input graph
        levels - the number of levels in the hierarchy of summary nodes to precompute
        observer - the job observer
        Returns:
        the graph layout

      • updateLayout

        void updateLayout(GraphLayout layout,
                  BaseSummaryNode node,
                  JobObserver observer)
        Update an existing layout by incrementally expanding the given summary node
        Parameters:
        layout - the graph to update
        node - the summary node to expand
        observer - the job observer

      • computeLayout

        GraphLayout computeLayout(BaseGraph graph,
                          JobObserver observer)
        Compute the layout for the entire graph
        Parameters:
        graph - the input graph
        observer - the job observer
        Returns:
        the graph layout

      • isZoomOptimized

        boolean isZoomOptimized()
        Determine whether the algorithm produces zoom-based (or zoom-optimized) layouts
        Returns:
        true if it produces zoom-optimized layouts

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Get the name of the algorithm
        Returns:
        the name
